1604064754_mirrored_HelloZeroNet_github.body: Just put in a PR that should take care of this.

@ymski I updated the pull request. You can now specify the browser when running start.py. Example, `python start.py firefox` will launch firefox instead of the default browser. If you don't specify it still uses the default browser.

topic.title: start.py script to start the server and launch a new browser tab
topic.body: This should resolve issue #17. By default running `python start.py` will launch the zeronet server in a subprocess then open the default browser. The user can also specify which browser to open. For example, `python start.py firefox`.
